detaileddescription.para: Changes the current working directory (CSD) of the running process to the path given by string-expression.

listitem.para: A path starting with / is treated as an absolute path.
A path not starting with / is treated as relative to the current CSD.
The initial process (/programs/init) starts with its CSD set to / (the root of the virtual filesystem).
Any child process launched (via CHAIN, for example) inherits the parentâ€™s current directory at the time of launch.

simplesect.para: Unlike Unix, Retro Rocket BASIC paths do not support . or ...
Directory traversal is only possible by specifying absolute or relative names explicitly.

sect4.title: Example
sect4.para: This changes the current directory to /programs, then launches demo from that directory.

listitem.para: Paths must exist; if the target directory is invalid, an error occurs (catchable with ON ERROR).
rocketsh provides a built-in command chdir (or short form cd) which performs the same action directly from the shell.
Changing the current directory affects file lookups for OPENIN, CHAIN, LIBRARY, and similar statements.
